article.title: Growth of bulges in disc galaxies since $z∼1$

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the solid black line in the surface brightness (SB) profiles represent?
choices: Combined bulge and disc component (total intensity)

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the criterion used to classify bulges as classical or pseudo in this figure?
choices: Position relative to the Kormendy relation for elliptical galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend is observed in the relationship between bulge half-light radius and galaxy half-light radius with decreasing redshift?
choices: The two half-light radii become increasingly different.
The bulge half-light radius becomes consistently smaller than the galaxy half-light radius.
The two half-light radii become increasingly similar.
There is no observable trend in the relationship.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to this table, how does the luminosity of pseudo bulges in the rest-frame I-band evolve from z ~ 1 to z ~ 0?
